page.title: 06Rail & Bus Routes nr Weston
page.content:
The{railway}line between Bicester and Oxford runs across the south-east corner of the area surveyed. It has recently been made single track and is now only used for occasional goods traffic. There are plans to use it more heavily in the near future to transport rubbish from Bristol to the Calvert Brickworks near Aylesbury.
There is only a Saturday bus service into Weston and this is a source of discontent in the village. The South Midlands Bus Company operates a daily service to Oxford which uses the A43. Villagers wishing to use this service are obliged to walk along the main road to a bus stop at the round-about. The Parish Council provides a midweek bus once a month for old people. Some residents operate a volunteer car scheme for essential services.
